body.p: Here are some more documentation if you want to know more.

section.title: Constraint Grammar
section.p: Constraint grammar is used in Sahka and Vasta. This is an article based on a presentation held at NODALIDA 2009 CG workshop in Odense.
Antonsen, L., Huhumarniemi, S. and Trosterud, T. 2009: Constraint Grammar in Dialogue Systems

section.title: The linguistic files
section.p: Files for OAHPA are in the ped-directory.

p.strong: The pedagogical lexicon. Files for generating the data base of word forms:

ul.li: sme/xml/semantic_sets.xml (the small Morfa-sets make bigger Leksa supersets)
Files with words from text books. The words are not generated. The files are not in use today. ../src/adv.txt ../src/conj.txt ../src/pp.txt

section.p: The "feedback" files add feedbacktags based on a combination of the morphological features specified in the lexicon, and the task itself. With help of the tags the system generates feedbackmessages for the user. Many small messages are linked together to a longer message.

p.strong: Other files offering help to the user:

section.p: comments.nob.xml (Feedback about how the user is succeeding with the tasks.)

p.strong: Files for analysing the free input in Sahka and Vasta:

ul.li: This gives morphological analysis to the user's input. It is normative, but it allows Proper nouns written with small initial letter, but marks it with an error tag.
This file disambuguates and adds error and navigation tags to the user's input.
